patient_data.allergies: Penicillin - causes severe rash and swelling

CRITICAL ALERTS.message: Patient presents with chest pain, shortness of breath, and other symptoms suggestive of a heart attack. Immediate evaluation and intervention are necessary to rule out acute coronary syndrome.

MISSING INFORMATION.message: No current medications listed. It is important to document all current and recent medications to assess for potential interactions or contraindications.

CLINICAL RECOMMENDATIONS.message: Urgent referral to the emergency department for further evaluation, including ECG, cardiac enzymes, and other tests to rule out acute coronary syndrome or other cardiac conditions.
Consider starting aspirin and nitroglycerin if not contraindicated while awaiting evaluation by healthcare providers.

original_form_text:
PATIENT INTAKE FORM
MERCY GENERAL HOSPITAL
Internal Medicine Department

PATIENT INFORMATION
Date: 03/15/2024
Patient Name: Robert M. Thompson
DOB: 08/12/1958  Age: 65  Gender: M
Weight: 185 lbs  Height: 5 ft 10 in
Phone: (555) 234-7890  Emergency Contact: Margaret Thompson (wife) - (555) 234-7891

INSURANCE INFORMATION
Primary Insurance: Blue Cross Blue Shield
Policy Number: BC789456123  Group Number: 45789
Secondary Insurance: Medicare Part B

CHIEF COMPLAINT
Primary reason for today's visit:
Chest pain and shortness of breath for the past 3 days. Pain is crushing, radiates to left arm.
Worse with exertion, some relief with rest. Also experiencing some nausea and sweating.
Concerned about heart attack.
Duration of symptoms: 3 days
Severity (1-10): 7

CURRENT MEDICATIONS
Please list ALL medications, including over-the-counter and supplements
Medication Name | Dosage | Frequency | Prescribing Doctor
Warfarin | 5mg | Daily | Dr. Johnson
Aspirin | 81mg | Daily | Dr. Johnson
Lisinopril | 10mg | Daily | Dr. Johnson
Metformin | 500mg | Twice daily | Dr. Martinez
Atorvastatin | 40mg | Daily | Dr. Johnson
Multivitamin | 1 tablet | Daily | Self

ALLERGIES
Drug Allergies:
Penicillin - causes severe rash and swelling
Reaction: Anaphylaxis in 1995, required hospitalization
Food Allergies:
Shellfish - mild reaction, hives
Environmental Allergies:
Seasonal pollen, dust mites

MEDICAL HISTORY
Previous Hospitalizations:
2019 - Heart catheterization, 2020 - COVID-19 pneumonia
Previous Surgeries:
2018 - Appendectomy, 2019 - Cardiac stent placement (LAD)
Chronic Conditions:
Diabetes, Hypertension, Heart Disease
Other: Coronary artery disease, Type 2 diabetes, hyperlipidemia

FAMILY HISTORY
Heart Disease: Yes  Relation: Father (MI at age 62)
Cancer: Yes  Type: Prostate  Relation: Brother
Diabetes: Yes  Relation: Mother, maternal grandmother
Mental Health: No

SOCIAL HISTORY
Tobacco Use: Former  Packs/day: 1  Years: 20 (quit 2019)
Alcohol Use: Occasional  Drinks/week: 2-3
Recreational Drugs: No
Exercise: Light  Frequency: Walking 3x/week

VITAL SIGNS (To be completed by medical staff)
Blood Pressure: 180 / 110  Heart Rate: 95  Temperature: 98.8
Respiratory Rate: 22  Oxygen Saturation: 96%  Pain Level: 7/10

REVIEW OF SYSTEMS
Constitutional: Fatigue
Cardiovascular: Chest Pain, Shortness of Breath, Palpitations
Respiratory: Shortness of Breath
Gastrointestinal: Nausea
Neurological: None
Psychiatric: Anxiety, Sleep Problems

Patient Signature: Robert Thompson  Date: 03/15/2024
Staff Signature: J. Davis, RN  Date: 03/15/2024

Form Version 2024.1 - Internal Medicine
